campaign.story:
Functions:
Magnetic dock
Stand
Grip ring
Detachable Leash
Tripod mount 
  Low profile at only 8 mm and snag free, Linkmount slides easily in and out of the tightest pockets and comes complete with a patented one touch easy release strap that lets you tether your phone to your belt loop, purse or wrist. A 360° grip ring allows you to spin, flip and grip your phone like never before and then with a simple twist the grip ring is transformed into and instant phone stand in both portrait and landscape mode.
We are proud that we can say Linkmount will be made in the USA. With our team of Rhode Island manufacturing partners we will further the RI State’s tradition of precision craftsmanship.
The Linkmount System is semi-permanently bonded to your phone or case. This is only possible thanks to 3M's VHB (very high bond) tape. This stuff is incredibly strong and is used in place of rivets, screws, and welds in many applications. 
When you get a new phone, you can take your Linkmount off with a piece of dental floss. Although the tape is not reusable, we will ship all our Linkmounts with an extra piece of VHB tape. 
PLAY

We designed our magnetic mount, the Simplemount out of frustration for cheap products that hold smartphones utilizing sticky "gecko pads", clunky mechanisms that were impossible to remove, and suctions cups that don't do their jobs.
The Simplemount is a reliable, durable, and easy to use magnetic dock. Although we initially designed them for cars, our prototype testers have found that they are quite handy: They allow you to mount your phone just about anywhere you can imagine. You can also use them to keep track of and organize most metal objects.
Using 3M technology Simplemount applies quickly and securely to almost any surface permanently. The Simplemount can be removed in 30 seconds without damage to the mounting surface.
Expand your Linkmount System. The Kickstarter checkout does not offer the ability to select multiple rewards. To purchase a reward and add ons, just add the value of the add on(s) to the pledge reward you are selecting.
For example: If you are getting Reward #2 ($20) and “Simplemounts Everywhere” ($10) your total pledge will be $30 ($20+$10).
                       For more info on the DIY Clip please see update #7
We are utilizing a platform called Backerkit to manage the fulfillment process. Participation is not mandatory, but greatly appreciated. Backerkit will help us deliver the Linkmount to you, on time.
You may choose to opt out of Backerkit, but it may slightly delay the delivery of your reward. 
You'll be asked to confirm your pledge information (quantity, color etc) and provide your shipping address through BackerKit at the end of the campaign. It also puts you in control of your pledge by allowing you to manage your own order quantity and shipping address. 
You will not receive a Kickstarter survey requesting this information. 
                                 We are seeking the help of the Kickstarter community to bring the Linkmount System into mass production. 
As this is our first product, we wanted to be positive that the Linkmount works. Because of this, we made a low production run of Beta prototypes. We have had over 100 people put them on their phones and test them extensively with excellent feedback.
We need funding to purchase tooling for mass production, which will drive down the costs of each unit. The beta prototype and our user testing has taught us where we can improve the Linkmount and those changes are ready to go into the final mold.
The design and engineering of the Linkmount has now been refined and ready to go into production. This would only have been possible with the help of our manufacturing partners. 
 Special thanks to AnderImage for the video.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any new products there is the possibility of delays. The following are risks that we have identified to be unlikely but potential issues we may face during our product delivery process: tooling production: Suppliers delaying the delivery of raw materials: Delay due to overwhelming demand. However, through Linkmount’s evolution we developed relationships with local experts they are ready to assist if issues arise. We have a back-up plan and a redundancy system to be able to honor our commitments
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!
We are shipping everyone's rewards as fast as we can! 
There are over 500 unique package groups, so we have to be very careful and methodical to make sure we get everyone's order right. 
So far we have gotten great feedback from people that have received their Linkmounts!

updates.update_userinfo: Packing is going great! And some additional Linkmount info you will need to know
updates.update_content:
We are making excellent progress on the packing, everything is going smoothly so far. 
We are working very hard to get everyone's Individual orders packaged and labeled. 
However do keep in mind we have 31 unique items, so many of your orders have to be individually packed in rather small groups depending on your specific color choices and Add-On's, this does take time. 
Originally we planned to ship out all the International orders first, however in order to expedite the process we will ship by package type. So for example everyone who ordered a just a Black Linkmount with a black leash will be shipped at the same time. regardless of your country.

We have received several hundred address changes. Thank you for checking in with us to get your address updated! Address changes are still trickling in, if you've been putting it off please help us expedite the process and get in touch.
We want to print the shipping labels and packing slips soon so:
MONDAY AT 8PM EDT (Eastern Daylight Time) We will lockdown all your addresses.

updates.update_userinfo: We are going to start shipping soon! Is your shipping address up to date?
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
Before we start shipping we need to make sure everyone's addresses are up to date.
If you have moved you have two options:
1. Find the Backerkit link we originally emailed you and change your address yourself.
Hello Everyone, Sorry I haven't posted this update sooner. I was waiting to get some good news from our leash supplier and didn't get any until recently.
Hello Everyone, please see video below:

Hello dear Backers,
We have spent the last month + working tirelessly on the assembly process and although we haven’t quite finished yet we are getting closer. It turns out our assembly estimate was a bit optimistic, the current Linkmount count is approximately 5500 and rising. While we have been working through the weekends, the 12 hour days were hard to keep up after a while. Therefore we have also interviewed some people to bring on two new full time assembly workers and they should be starting this week as we now have the necessary workers compensation insurance and payroll services.

So we have been tweaking and tailoring the assembly process this week and have already made quite a few Linkmounts, (~400 and counting).
We have around 8000 Linkmounts Systems to make so this puts our shipping estimate towards the end of April. 
It looks like we can finish about 200 Linkmount Systems per hard 12 hour day with our current setup. That is three full time people doing assembly. We will try to get more people in to help when we start packing them and will of course be working the weekends as well.
The mold maker has made the necessary changes to the mold and the Heatstaker now clamps the parts very nicely. We also decided to have them sandblast the mold for a nicer finish on the parts.

updates.update_userinfo: Heatstaker is here! One more tweak and we should be rolling.
updates.update_content: We finally got the Heatstaker back and it's an awesome machine! Sonitek did a great job on it.

campaign.story:
Featured in:
Host a Rocket Party!
See us on Geek Mom!
Hello Fellow KickStarters and Rocketeers!
"Just released in MAKE Magazine Issue #39!"
As Seen in MAKE Issue #39, Page 80
 We're Rick Schertle and Keith Violette, the founders of www.AirRocketWorks.com  We would like to introduce you to the fun, easy, low cost and educational way to learn about rockets and other things that fly.  Rick first introduced the Compressed Air Rocket launcher (CAR v1.0) to the world in MAKE magazine issue #15, where he showed how to build a compressed air rocket launcher for launching paper and tape rockets hundreds of feet.  His design utilizing a sprinkler valve and PVC construction has been duplicated countless times since the article came out.  We now have a new article about the Air Rocket Glider (ARG) and we have updated the launcher to make it even better.
Rick and Keith, presenting at the NY Maker Faire. If you have never attended a Maker Faire, they are great fun for the entire family. There were more than 100 Maker Faires held around the world last year. Click on the picture to find a faire near you.
Rick is in his twenty-first year teaching middle school social studies and language arts in San Jose, CA where he also leads after-school Maker clubs. He’s the founder and director of the Washington Maker Workshop, a non-profit Maker space in a low-income neighborhood of San Jose.
Rick at NY Maker Faire, test launching a functional prototype KickSat on a paper rocket, CAR v1.0 in foreground. Thanks Zac!
Rick has also exhibited his launcher at all the Bay Area Maker Faires, the Detroit Maker Faire ,and the New York Maker Faire. At each Faire, he shows hundreds if not thousands of people how easy and fun compressed air rocketry can be. He has also earned the Editor's Choice and Educators Choice Award at nearly every event.
Just some of the awards Rick has earned
Keith is a mechanical design engineer with 18 years of experience designing robotic prosthetic arms (LUKE Arm), medical devices, and ultra-precision air bearings in New Hampshire. He has built several CNC machines and 3D printers, as well as founded a local CNC group. Keith is also a contributing writer for MAKE Magazine, has designed the Air Rocket Glider in MAKE #39, and helped redesign the CAR 2.0.
Keith and his kids helping an excited young rocketeer at the NY Maker Faire
When East and West Makers meet - How the ARG was developed:
One snowy Saturday morning in early 2012, Keith was out launching some compressed air rockets and a folding wing glider with his kids (both inspired by Rick's MAKE articles), when he realized it would be fun to combine them.  He created a 3D model that afternoon, 3D printed out some prototypes that evening, and was back outside for testing the next day.  Keith contacted Rick, supplied Rick a working prototype ARG, and they have been working together ever since.
First Air Rocket Glider (ARG) Prototype on left, Ready to launch on double barrel custom machined launcher on right (not for sale)
Keith and Rick have been refining and optimizing the design of the Air Rocket Glider (ARG) for over a year, and have plastic molding vendor already selected.
The New CAR v2.0:
The new design of the Compressed Air Rocket launcher uses all metal parts, rated to 150 PSI minimum.  There is a sturdy wooden base, that allows the unit to be folded up for easy storage and transport.  All that is required for assembly is a screwdriver and an adjustable wrench.  No need for the messy PVC adhesive, soldering, or batteries which were required for the original version 1.0.  Also, the air reservoir has been optimized, greatly reducing the volume of compressed air in each shot, without affecting performance.  This also means much less pumping!  We have already tested out our supply chain for all of the CAR v2.0 parts, and have all of the vendors on board.
Why we need you!
Here is the point where we need the help of the KickStarter community; to take this from small quantity prototypes and bring it to production.  The main expense is the cost of the plastic injection mold that the ARG components will be produced in.  Also, the cost of the pneumatic components for the CAR v2.0 drops with volume, which will allow us to provide it to you at a competitive price.
To minimize any issues with the molded plastic parts, we have had exacting prototypes made that are true to the production part dimensions.  This allows us to check the fit and finish, and ensure great performance.
Now, on to the fun stuff! The Rewards:
Reward 1 - The Sticker:
The AirRocketWorks Sticker
For reward #1, you will receive a sticker, and our thanks for your support.  If you like, we will add your name to our contributor list on our website, www.AirRocketWorks.com
Reward 2 - The Folding Wing Glider - FWG:
Folding Wing Glider kit, wings open.
PLAY

 The video above shows Rick's son launching a Folding Wing Glider.
In MAKE Magazine issue #31, Rick reintroduced the world to the nearly forgotten Folding Wing Glider (FWG).
This reward contains a kit of parts and detailed instructions on how to build the Folding Wing Glider, pictured above.  It is launched using a large rubber band, with the wings folded back.  During ascent, the wind resistance against the wings holds them back against the body.  When the plane slows down at its maximum altitude, the rubber band pops the wings open.  Each wing rotates forward on the wing pivot wire, then both wings rotate down on the central wing pivot.  Then the plane glides down gently.  This is based on the ingenious design of Jim Walker, who first patented the idea in 1940.
Reward #3 - The Air Rocket Glider - ARG:
Air Rocket Glider - ARG, wings open
PLAY

The Air Rocket Glider will be made from a tough injection molded ABS plastic, the same kid-safe material that Legos are made from.  The body tube of the ARG is a tough non-brittle nylon material that can really take a beating.  The nose of the ARG is cast from a soft super-ball type material for safety and resilience.  The wings are made from 3/32" thick Balsa wood, which is lightweight and stiff.  If the wings become damaged, wing templates can be downloaded and printed from our website and used to cut out new wings from balsa wood sheet available from local craft stores.  NOTE: This reward level does not include the launcher.  This is being offered for the thousands of existing owners and builders of a first generation compressed air launcher.  It includes the smaller diameter launch tube required to launch the ARG.  See reward level 5 & 6 below, which include the launcher and the ARG kit.  If you would like to purchase additional ARG kits, please contact us directly.
Reward #4 - The New Compressed Air Rocket launcher - CAR v2.0:
Compressed Air Rocket launcher CAR v2.0 (pump not included)
CAR 2.0 kit of parts. Click image to view build instructions.
Paper Rocket Templates, rocket forming tubes
                                                   This reward level features the latest design of the Compressed Air Rocket launcher, version 2.0 - CAR v2.0.  It's easier to build, will fold up to save space, requires less pumping, but has the same great level of performance as the old design.  It's a complete kit of all the parts required to build a heavy duty launcher made from industrial grade components that will last for years.  The only tools required to build it are a Philips screw driver and an adjustable wrench.  Detailed instructions are included, and are also available on our website.  Also included is a paper template and instructions for making and customizing paper rockets.  Simply photocopy the template, cut out the pattern, build the rocket on the supplied build tube using masking tape, and you are ready for action!  Build time for these rockets is less than 10 minutes, and even kids as young as 5 can build them with a little assistance.  Customize your creation with markers, patterned duct tape, etc.   Use your imagination!  Also, this launcher can be used to launch foam rockets as well, info on our website.  These are great for kids parties, scouting events, teaching about physics, etc.  NOTE: This reward level DOES NOT INCLUDE the Air Rocket Glider kit of parts.  If you choose to purchase a ARG kit in the future, the required launch tube is supplied in this kit.  See reward level 5 and 6 below for launchers that include the ARG kit.
Reward #5 - The New CAR v2.0 and one ARG kit:
CAR v2.0, shown with ARG ready to be launched! (pump not included)
 This reward level includes the launcher from reward level #4, and the same ARG kit from reward level #3.  To switch from launching paper rockets to launching the ARG, simply swap the launch tube on the outlet of the silver valve.  Both launch tubes are included.  If you would like to purchase additional ARG kits, please contact us directly.
Reward #6 - The New CAR v2.0 AND one ARG kit AND one FWG kit:
RULE THE SKIES! This reward level includes the CAR v2.0 launcher from reward level #4, one ARG kit from reward level #3 AND one FWG kit from reward level #2.  If you would like to purchase additional ARG or FWG kits, please contact us directly.
NOTE: The Compressed Air Rocket launcher operates at pressures up to 150 PSI, ADULT SUPERVISION IS REQUIRED.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are risks with all KickStarter projects, but we have been doing all that we can to minimize the risks on this project.

Sticker & Thanks, Reward #1:
Not much risk here - but plenty of gratitude.

FWG Risks, Reward #2:
This is a slight improvement to a kit that Rick has been supplying for years, and is already tooled up to produce hundreds of kits per month. There is very little risk on this proven product.

ARG Risks, Reward #3:
While this is a brand new design, we have tested out several rounds of prototypes to ensure reliable operation of the parts. We have sent the designs out to several trusted injection molding vendors for quotes, and have arranged to work with one of them with a proven history on a previous project. The main risk for this reward level is a delayed shipping date, as the following tasks are serial: Order and machine the mold (4-6 weeks), Verify the quality of the first molded parts (1-2 weeks), procure the first batch of parts (3-4 weeks).

CAR v2.0 Risks, Reward #4, 5 & 6:
While this is a major improvement over the original version 1.0 CAR, we have also simplified and refined the launcher design and packaging. We already have our second prototype order in process with our pneumatic component vendor, and have tested the function and quality of every component. We have also have secured a trusted vendor we have used on previous projects to manufacture the wooden stands for the launcher. We also have an established payment process in place with both vendors to allow for quick order placement once the campaign has ended.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Manufacturing of the Air Rocket Glider is moving along but quite complicated.  Keith is finishing up the fuselage mold and will hopefully begin shooting pieces soon. If you responded to the survey a while back, you should have received your order if you live in the US.  As we've mentioned before, the Air Rocket Glider will ship at a later date.  Keith has been working hard in his now cold, New Hampshire shop to get the parts injection molded.

Kickstarter Rocketeers,
This week nearly all of our domestic US orders have shipped, and we are starting on our international orders.  Again, we want to give you a huge thanks for your support in this exciting project.  It's so exciting to have this Compressed Air Launcher 2.0 (CAR 2.0) that we've worked so hard on, out there on a large scale.  The CAR 1.0 was extremely popular and we learned many things as it's production grew.  Through it all, we wanted to create an industrial strength, high air pressure rated system that would last practically forever and was still affordable.  That's why we're proud of what we've accomplished with the CAR version 2.0.

campaign.story:
Thanks to all our backers for making PowerUp 3.0 a reality!
Funding has ended on Kickstarter, but you can visit poweruptoys.com to order a PowerUp 3.0 and many more products from our collection. 
Here’s how you can stay in touch regarding future product launches, feedback surveys, promotions and more: 
Subscribe to the PowerUp Newsletter 
Follow us on Facebook, Google+, youtube and Twitter
Media & bloggers – if you’d like to run a story, let us know! 
The PowerUp 3.0 Smart Module
PowerUp 3.0 received the Popular Science Best of NY Toy Fair 2013 Award
Fold It: Simply fold a piece of copier paper into a paper airplane
Attach It: Attach the Smart Module to your paper plane with the patented clips underneath the Smart Module.
Connect It: Start the app to connect to the Smart Module with your iPhone.
Fly It: Push throttle to full and launch the paper airplane high up into the sky. Tilt your smartphone to the left or to the right to steer your plane, increase or reduce throttle to go up or down.
PLAY

Crash-proof carbon fiber frame 
Precision control for easy flying 
Automatic thrust to assist when banking
Lithium Polymer Battery provides 10 minute of flight on one charge 
Ascend/Descend using the throttle lever
Tilt iPhone right or left for maneuvering
Battery level indicator
Charging status indicator
Range indicator
Thrust level indicator
Artificial horizon
Air Traffic Control (ATC)  
Tilt iPhone right or left for maneuvering
PowerUp 3.0’s wireless communication is based on Bluetooth Smart technology, the newest standard for extremely power-efficient wireless communication.
BLE - Bluetooth Low Energy
Lightweight and small
180 feet / 55 meters of range
Wireless firmware update
Micro-USB charging
1000 mAh Lithium Polymer power pack (PERFECT PACKAGE only)
The power pack will give you non-stop flying and can charge your smartphone as well when your power runs low during flight
iOS and Android 4.3 or higher
 Rewards
Special Thanks to:
Avital Goitein, Ulrich Ditschler, Tobias Dazenko, Prashant Vaibhav Yasmin Poplawski, Andrew Sung, Cynthia Tang, Vivien Yeung, Anat Lustinger, Shay Vadel, Zoe and Lutz Vogel, Michael Muller and to all of my mentors and supporters that helped make this a reality.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We already signed agreements with key suppliers and contract manufacturers. Design for manufacturing and the iOS app are complete. We are ready to begin manufacturing the first run of PowerUp 3.0. However, delays in production may happen, depending on the factory’s production pipeline and component availability.

There is a risk with development of the Android app: It is unclear whether the Android app will perform at the same level as the iOS app. The Android API is still in its early stage and has not been fully tested for maturity and stability. With PowerUp 3.0, we are pushing the limits of Bluetooth Smart technology.

In comparison, our iOS code has been tested and perfected over the past 1.5 years as we have worked with Apple in finding and fixing problems in Apple’s own Bluetooth implementation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
High Snobiety: "Outfitted in a clean modern design, the PA1 delivers bold audio performance"
BLTD: "There’s an amazingly minimal bluetooth speaker on Kickstarter and I’m not going to show it to you? Please!"
Interior Design 2014: "It’s simple, stylish, smart yet sophisticated. Perfect addition for your modern home"
Studio Dope: "Studio Proper made it easy to love their newest design"
Sound now has a place - All bluetooth speakers require a surface upon which to lay the product, in wall mounting the PA1 not only are you reducing desk or table clutter, but the you open yourself into a more elegant relationship to your listening environment.
A speaker has one simple task; to produce beautiful satisfying sound, yet so many fall short. The typical gripe with battery powered Bluetooth speakers is that they are weak, prone to audio distortion and lack full dynamic range. 
Looking for a great Christmas gift for a loved one? Pledge for a PA1 and give out an Christmas card to tell that special someone what a great product they will be receiving in April 2014.
You can download the instruction and print your own PA1 Christmas card from this link here. The card will contain a web link which they can visit and read up on their new speaker system (webpage will be launched before Christmas)!
The PA1 is a beautiful Aluminum Bluetooth speaker, designed for what we believe to be most important: usability, great sound output and quality materials.
The driving force of the design was to provide everyday users with a true value design, which encompassed amazing sound without unnecessary elements, available for a fraction of regular wall speaker pricing. We’ve taken everything we’ve learned from our customer base and experience of making IOS accessories and fused it into the PA1. The visual styling and user interaction reflect the PA1’s intuitive intention – it’s a speaker that brings a new feel into the everyday home.
Great design & sound ought to be universal; we wanted to push beyond the norm of comparative products and were dedicated to designing everyday speakers that were just as beautiful and powerful in sound.
We decided to keep PA1 wired to avoid sacrificing power or sound quality, as is necessary with portable battery-powered speakers. This wiring allows us to power larger drivers, providing you with a fuller, well balanced and incredibly rich audio experience.
Not only can PA1 be installed in under a minute, its design is flexible, PA1 can be easily moved with a simple 'turn and click' motion to any room/space that you have a Wall Mount installed. Now you have the flexibility to move your music as you move around the house, whilst allowing it to work flawlessly as a permanently installed speaker. By leveraging our universal Wallee™ 'X-Lock', Mount Disks and stands, we're able to offer the best of both worlds.
 On, Off, and Pairing are all intuitive and within reach - no need to compete with multiple buttons or switches.
PA1 connects wirelessly to any Bluetooth enabled device. We've selected a premium Bluetooth module ensuring clear, consistent pairing and high quality audio streaming. PA1 also remembers up to 5 devices and automatically pairs when in range, so you'll only ever need to physically pair the first time you turn it on.
We're really proud to announce that based on early feedback we've worked with our internal and external engineers to add Dual Bluetooth Stereo Pairing (also known as True Wireless Stereo). This means that two PA1's will now pair together creating a true left and right channel stereo experience allowing two PA1's to be placed up to 10 meters apart. Now speakers can be placed at each side of a room for a huge sound experience!
3 years ago we developed our 'X-Lock' modular mounting system, dubbed "Wallee™", to enable mounting your iPad and iPhone across a range of mounts and stands. PA1 is designed around the same system, and looks great when used in conjuction with other components from our best selling range of Wall and Table Stands.
Mount your iPad alongside PA1 and you've got a complete, powerful entertainment hub. The modern day jukebox perfect for entertaining. iOS devices make for beautiful, capable media centres. PA1 is designed to work in harmony alongside your iPad or iPhone.
Interchangeable fabric covers allow you to personalise the aesthetic to best match your environment. Covers will initially be offered in Black and White. Backers will also be able to choose between either Black or White braided power cables.
Machined Aluminum Unibody construction for unrivaled rigidity, with a fine bead blast, anodized finish.  
Our driver arrangement provides full stereo sound through 3 drivers. 1 tweeter for clear highs, and two large stereo drivers for deep, warm mids and lows.
We're the 3 year old industrial design studio behind the Wallee™ range of iPhone & iPad cases, stands and modular mounts. Based in Melbourne, Australia
As a company, we are obsessed with customer service and work hard to deliver product happiness no matter what. We are prepared to do whatever it takes to keep our backers and customers happy.
We back our product so strongly that we openly invite anyone to visit our studio in Melbourne, Australia to meet the team and put these speakers through their paces in person.
Have further questions? Or just want to learn more about PA1 from the designers behind the product? We've set up an exclusive Skype account that you can reach us on anytime we're in the studio. Call us on Skype username 'studio.proper.kshotline'.
We appreciate you taking part and supporting this exciting product, and we're proud to offer deep discounts on PA1 to our backers for the duration of this campaign.  PA1 will retail at $250.00 once our campaign is completed.
We’ve spent the last 10 months developing this wonderful product focusing on everything from sound quality, use case scenarios, modularity, Bluetooth connectivity and aesthetics.  After 6 exhaustive rounds of prototyping, and months of rigorous testing, we believe we are ready for production. Here is our anticipated schedule..
We have partnered with Shipwire to handle warehousing, logistics and the final leg of distribution and shipping. They have successfully shipped our products to customers world-wide for the last 2 years, and have plenty of experience handling Kickstarter product delivery.
We're obsessed with designing for people, and feel there's no better way to do that then to allow the kickstarter community and existing customers to participate in making this exciting project come to life.
Press Kit Download Link: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/ahf28k3fhnu7c5u/bPBynQ0FPm
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter campaign, and we know all too well that every 
pre-production product has inherent risks and challenges, some of them unforeseen. 

We've been developing and manufacturing consumer products for close to 3 years and have a deep understand of the entire process. We consider our manufacturing experience to be one of our greatest strengths at Studio Proper. Through selling our current range of products, we have very strong existing manufacturing relationships.

We've spent the last year working hard vetting factories, coordinating assembly of the final product, and cultivating positive, personal relationships with our suppliers (this is really important in China!). We've finalised the product design focusing on manufacturability, developed working prototypes, and we have structured QC for every unit that comes off the production line. We've also completed detailed site inspections for the manufacturers that we've selected.

We've learned an immense amount along the way, and we've taken pre-emptive steps that we hope will mean there are no surprises along the way. We've invested a lot of focus pre-Kickstarter, to get to a point where we're confident the product is proven and manufacturable with minimal alterations.

That said, producing anything has challenges. International holidays can often slow down production time and there's always the chance for unforeseen issues, but we're confident that once we begin manufacturing with the funds this campaign raises, we've done the hard work upfront to make sure everything goes smoothly. Past that, we've created a supply chain that can scale and distribute effectively.

Our 4 strict promises to our backers are:

1. BE TRANSPARENT AT ALL TIMES

2. COMMUNICATE REGULARLY AND IN DETAIL

3. INCLUDE BACKERS IN THE PROCESS

4. INCLUDE BACKERS IN ANY DECISIONS THAT NEED TO BE MADE

We are very proud of this product, and very dedicated to bringing it to you. Let's make this happen!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Backers!
You've all been great in supporting and building this campaign, and we're so grateful for that. We're now moving into the home stretch and need your help kicking it into overdrive. We're working hard to maximise every minute to get PA1 made, we know you'll love it!
We're putting major emphasis on new media coverage and we've just been blogged about by Highsnobiety. Lets do our bit to amplify this great coverage by clicking like, tweet and share on the post, available here:

We realise that Kickstarter is purely the beginning of a conversation, and that including early backers in that conversation is one of the greatest advantages of Kickstarter. 
Based on overwhelming early feedback from our wonderful backers, and 10 days of serious planning with internal and external engineers, were proud to announce that PA1 now includes Dual Bluetooth Stereo Pairing (also known as True Wireless Stereo). This means that two PA1's will now pair together creating a true left and right channel stereo experience when placed up to 10 meters apart. PA1 speakers can now be placed side by side, or opposing ends of a room for a huge sound experience!

campaign.story:
PLAY

Update above. Please watch! 
10 day update, thank you so much for your support so far. Please spread the word lets get this project started! 
Why Colladjust?
You have tried to iron it, starch it or press it and now your settling for the tie... Don't! 
Colladjust is a simple, lightweight and innovative little addition to your collar. Simply place it under your collar where you would usually place a tie and it will support your collar nicely. Once in place you can move your collar by bending and twisting it to the height or width you like!  
Lightwright, Low Profile
Production Model, 3rd Gen
Colour possibilities
I have just received these first two samples from my supplier. They included a milky white alternative silicone which in many ways I prefer. If you guys can vote on it that would be great. Alternatively we will think about giving pledgers the option at the end of the project. 

(the clear silicone tubing is wider in this prototype. In reality it will be 3mm in diameter like the milky white tubing in the image. A perfect snug fit. 
two variations
Adjustable Size
Colladjust is unisex and can be used with any fabric type. The thin silicone tips can be simply trimmed with a pair of scissors to meet your required neck size.
Cutting colladjust to size with pliers or scissors
freshly cut production sample.
Before and After
various shirt types with colladjust
Prototypes
The prototype looks simple because it is, it has no frills, it just works. I have developed the product into a more appealing and functional design choosing specific materials that do their job perfectly. 
Support Bracket - This is to keep the back of the product straight at all times and stop it from kinking when you adjust it.
Inner Spine - The thickness of the inner spine is just right to make it easy to adjust but also keep the its shape permanently. It is made from aluminium which helps to keep the product light and comfortable.
Silicone Coating - the rough silicone coating grips to the inside of your collar to stop it moving throughout the day. It is clear to make it invisible under thin clothing. 
Final Product
If you pledge for me and order a Colladust you really have something to look forward to. The final production model will be of the highest quality made from silver coloured aluminium spine and crystal clear silicone!

All products will be sent in cardboard lined jiffy bags so your colladjust will arrive in pristine condition. 
Tagging Stickers
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As of now I cannot see any reason why Colladjust could not be in your collar by January. However if problems do arise I promise to keep you updated at all times. 

The first batch will be produced by my long term working partner in China, Natalie. The second batch with retail packaging will be produced in Germany. Meetings with high street retailers will begin in January. 

Step by step...

1. Concept refinement (done September)
2. Material selection (done September)
3. Functional prototype (done October) 
4. Production management ( November end)
5. Delivery and Quality control ( Late January)
6. Shipping (Late January)

I have the contacts, skills and knowledge to get this project finished. It's 90% there, I just need the capital to put Colladjust into your hands. We really believe this product will become a high street essential. We need you to be the first ones to use and enjoy the product. 

Pledge just £10 and you will never have a bad collar day again. I wish you all the best and thank you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello there, 
I know understandably a lot of you would be loosing faith in this project, this is to let you know I am still here and am actively working on the project alongside my full time commitments. 
I am currently still making the first batch by hand at home. The delays are down to a number of things. I didn't initially forecast that there would be so many delays in the project down to a lot of testing problems with manufacturers which i can only really blame on myself for not taking full control of the project. I would say it has been one of the most stressful projects I have ever worked on. 

Understandable there were a lot of abusive comments on the page, some of them were too much for me to handle since I have been spending a lot of time and energy into the project. I have been away in Asia the last few months for job commitments. I am back now and working on this project as much as I can in my spare time to get something out.

Hi everyone, 
another update to let you know I am still active in this project, around being very busy with my full time job. I have been working away a lot in the recent months.
I am making the first line of products at the moment and am meeting a supplier in Hong Kong on the 11th Oct to discuss how to move forward. It is always easier to speak in person and as I am there for work then It makes sense to speak face to face with a supplier about this project and hand them a perfect sample to copy. 
Will not be long now, I will post pictures of the current products I have as soon as I have time and get home.

The new German material and silicone just arrived, i have the correct tooling and materials now, so ready for production.
More photos to follow. �
Matt

Firstly I am terribly sorry this update did not post from early July. 
Hello guys, 
I sincerely apologize for the lack of an update, I have just changed my settings to receive comment notifications which I didn't before. 
Please do not worry too much. There are still issues with quality. In reality it would be much easier to travel to my manufacture and tell them exactly what is going wrong. Those who have experience with foreign manufacturers will know how difficult even the simplest of tasks is to get right. 

I am starting to consider hand making all the products for you guys it will take a couple of weeks in the evenings after work. I have all the silicone support brackets and they are fine, its the quality of the wire that troubles me. I have tooling I just need to order the materials. This way I can assure the quality of the product and can send several to the manufacturer to copy.

Whatever happens I promise you all a high quality product and that is what I will deliver. It will not be too long and I respect your patience.

I wish you all the best. 

I will post regular updates from here on in. 

Matt

Hi guys I have placed the final order with the chosen supplier.
I want you all to know I apologies for the delay but I really have had problems with suppliers I trusted in the past among other things.
The next update will be with the shipment and notifying delivery.
Thanks for your patience.

Hi Guys
I wanted to wait untill I have this sample from my second supplier. All in all it's good, just a tiny bit on the soft side. This will be altered for the final sample I have ordered.
hopefully one last sample from them.
As you can see I have included two end caps that slide on tightly to really hide the metal well after you have cut the product to your neck size.

Hello everyone, 
Finally my manufacturing partners are back from their New Year celebrations and we can get down to business. 

As Ive said before I apologise for the delay but it really was of no fault of my own. In reality I should have posted the shipping time a couple of months later to cover situations like this but I wanted to get the product to you ASAP. I apologise for that. 

I hope everything runs smoothly from now onwards and I will post some images of the final product before I ship them out when the time comes. 

Thank you and all the best, 

Matt

Hello everyone, 
Thank you for your patience, I received he kickstarter funds last Friday evening. This week I will be sorting out the order. 
I have to apologise for the fact I did not realise it took so long to receive the funds so there is a tiny delay on the project.

Hey guys 
I have had a few emails from people who did not get the chance to pledge and some from those that still want to add more units. 
I have set up a website at  colladjust.com for people to make more pre-orders or new pre-orders.
